channel.title: Tfc on guest@gbrls.github.io
channel.description: Recent content in Tfc on guest@gbrls.github.io

item.title: license - tfc 2024
item.description: This is a writeup for the TFC CTF 2024. For the challenge we are provided with a single binary called license. Let’s check the file: $ file license license: ELF 64-bit LSB pie executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, BuildID[sha1]=336b3d35e851f9b302e938e557e766e57ed406b7, for GNU/Linux 3.2.0, stripped What I expected, a regular linux ELF binary, so let’s see the security measures: $ checksec license Arch: amd64-64-little RELRO: Full RELRO Stack: Canary found NX: NX enabled PIE: PIE enabled Ok, everything looking normal so far.
